guide.introduction: This is my attempt to make an electronic fuel injection (efi) system. The goal is to make it run better than my carburetor, and get better fuel efficiency. I'm using a Parallax Propeller micro-controller because of its 8 core design. Most of the sensors and efi hardware are from Holley because I had a kit from them that was sitting around not doing anything. This "guide" should help you get started in building an efi system, but keep in mind that its pretty complicated and expensive. At least by my broke college student standards.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is my attempt to make an electronic fuel injection (efi) system. The goal is to make it run better than my carburetor, and get better fuel efficiency. I'm using a Parallax Propeller micro-controller because of its 8 core design. Most of the sensors and efi hardware are from Holley because I had a kit from them that was sitting around not doing anything. This "guide" should help you get started in building an efi system, but keep in mind that its pretty complicated and expensive. At least by my broke college student standards.

Relevant parts
  • Parallax Propellor processor and all the stuff to program and run it.
  • LM1949 Injector Drive Controller x how ever many injectors you're running
  • MCP3208 or similar analog to digital converter (ADC)
  • manifold air pressure sensor (MAP)
  • manifold air temperature sensor (MAT)
  • engine coolant temperature sensor (ECT)
  • oxygen sensor (OS)
  • thermocouple/exhaust temperature sensor (EGT)
  • crankshaft position sensor/hall effect sensor
  • manifold air flow sensor (I'm currently not trying to use one, but it's an option)
Tools
  • Lots of tools. Stuff I've used so far: lathe, drill+bits, mig welder, soldering iron, wire stripper/cripper, tap and die set, and that's all I can think of right now
